Class dbConnection

java.lang.Object
dbConnection
public class dbConnection extends Object
Manages the connection to the SQL database, and abstracts various read/write operations.

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public void connect()
      Constructs an SQL connection to the AWS database as a certain user. Note: the TAMU Wifi or VPN must be used for this connection to work.

    • printResultSet

      public void printResultSet​(ResultSet result) throws SQLException
      Pretty-prints a result set.
      Parameters:
      result - The result set to print.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • sendCommand

      public ResultSet sendCommand​(String cmd) throws SQLException
      Returns the result of the command that was sent to the database
      Parameters:
      cmd - The actual command that is sent to the database
      Returns:
      the result from the command that was just executed
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is any error with the command

    • sendUpdate

      public void sendUpdate​(String cmd) throws SQLException
      Function that does not return anything, but string is coonstly being updated
      Parameters:
      cmd - The actual command that is sent to the database constantly being updated
      Throws:
      SQLException - if there is any error with the command

    • addItemToDatabase

      public int addItemToDatabase​(double quantity, String units, String newItem, int minQuantity)
      used for adding new items to the inventory
      Parameters:
      quantity - of new item
      units - of new item
      newItem - the item name being added
      minQuantity - the minimum quantity

    • findNewId

      public int findNewId​(String table)
      Given a table with id values, find the next highest ID to assign.

    • addProductToDatabase

      public int addProductToDatabase​(String name, double price, int[] itemList, double[] portionList, String date, int orderId)
      This Method allows a new product built up of items to be created which can then be added to individual orders in the database.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the product
      price - price of the product
      itemList - List of items in the product
      portionList - List of the portions of each item in the product
      Returns:
      The id of the newly created product

    • addOrderToDatabase

      public double addOrderToDatabase​(int[] productList, double discount, double subtotal, String date)
      This method adds the Order to the Database This method returns immediately or throws an error sends a query to the database to see orders calculate the discount recieve productList and insert order values
      Parameters:
      productList - A list of product as input
      discount - The discount amount
      subtotal - The total before taxes and discount
      date - The date the order was added
      Returns:
      the total accounting in taxes

    • takeInventory

      public static void takeInventory​(dbConnection db, String date)
      Creates a snapshot of all of the items and their current quantities
      Parameters:
      date - the current date.

    • getItemHashmap

      public HashMap<Integer,​Item> getItemHashmap()
      Builds and returns a hash map representation of items from the database. Items are mapped by their IDs

    • getProductDefs

      public ProductDef[] getProductDefs()
      Builds and returns an array of product definitions based on the ProductDef table in the database.

    • currentDate

      public String currentDate()
      Gets the current Date

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the database connection
